stem: A 45-year-old client with a large intracranial hemorrhage has a sudden change in vital signs. Based on the documentation in the Critical Neuro-Surgical & ICP Surveillance tab, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute neuro-resuscitation for brainstem compression.
Background: Intracerebral bleed (Left). Current GCS was 9.
Assessment: Client is now GCS 4. The right pupil is 6mm and sluggish.
Recommendation: Immediate osmotic therapy.

actionOptions.text: Administer STAT IV Mannitol or Hypertonic Saline (3% NaCl)
Hyperventilate the client temporarily (to a PCO2 of 30–35 mmHg)
Place the client in a flat Supine position to increase brain blood flow
Encourage the client to perform an active Valsalva maneuver to lower pressure

parameterOptions.text: Pulse pressure trends and Heart rate stability (ICP Triad check)
Pupillary reaction and Level of Consciousness (GCS)
Daily measurement of fasting serum glucose
Presence of a positive Trousseau sign

rationale.correct: This is Impending Uncal Herniation (c2), evidenced by the classic Cushing's Triad: Widening pulse pressure (120), Bradycardia (48), and Irregular respirations (8). The ICP of 42 is critically high. Priority actions are osmotic diuresis with Mannitol (a1) and temporary therapeutic hyperventilation (a2) to cause cerebral vasoconstriction and drop the pressure fast. Monitoring focus is on the Triad components (p1) and neurological reflexes (p2).
clinicalPearls: Cushing's Triad is the body's 'Last Gasp' effort to get blood to the brain; it is a LATE sign of herniation.
The pulse pressure is the difference between Systolic and Diastolic; in herniation, the systolic spikes while the diastolic stays the same or drops.
Herniation usually kills by compressing the brainstem, specifically the vasomotor and respiratory centers.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking the BP 192/72 and HR 48 is 'Stable' because the MAP is okay.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the pulse pressure is WIDENING and the HR is dropping, it is brain compression. Normal BP/HR logic for shock is reversed in ICP.

mnemonic.title: Brain Pressure Reverse
mnemonic.expansion: BP: Up (Wide). HR: Down (Brady). RR: Down (Irregular). Brain: Done (Dead).
